website_summaries.verdict: This versatile drill is a good fit if you're looking for a single, multipurpose drill you can use for all your home projects.
pros: Variable speed gives you greater control over the drilling
Won't overheat when using for extended periods of time
Lightweight and easy to use one-handed
cons: Users have said that the keyless chuck often arrives too tight

website_summaries.verdict: Great for light work around the home like hanging pictures, curtain rods, or shelves, and even the occasional heavy-duty outdoor repair or construction project.
pros: The corded 120 V, 5.2 A drill provides a reliable 0-1,500 rpm
Keyless chuck for fast bit changes, and a constant power button keeps the drill turning
Users are pleased with the ergonomic, comfortable grip
With proper use, this drill can handle some fairly heavy-duty, multi-day projects
cons: Keyless chuck often arrives wound too tight
Additional screwdriver or drill bits need to be purchased separately
The cord is shorter than some would like

customer_reviews.title: drilling on
customer_reviews.text: First I am a woman of 75 years. I find I need to do small repairs by myself now. I like the drill. It is not too heavy. However I am not strong enough to tighten it very much. The directions act as if you are a man and know how to use a drill. I did not. It does not answear my simplest questions. I however went on youtube. I watched several vidoes on the drill. Now I know why the bit kept falling out. It just was not tight enough. Also the bits I bought were just cheep junk. I like the drill and would recomend it.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie dean

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2 of these instead of 1 battery
customer_reviews.text: Gave up on the rechargeables - could have easily bought 2 of these for the price of one new battery. And really, for most of us who use these around the house, the only feature I really had to have from the rechargeable was the keyless chuck. If you have to use one all the time, daily and professionally, stick with your high-end rechargeables. But if you find yourself just using one a few times a year, stick with the cord. Its 5 amps never run out and it's actually as light if not lighter than the rechargeables.
customer_reviews.author: StarvinMarvin

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it, couldn't even drill holes in my wooden chair and the chuck started to melt after one usage. I literally just bought it two days ago and just received it today. Do yourself a favor and buy a real drill.
customer_reviews.author: Krystel N.

customer_reviews.title: Keyless chuck overly tightened from factory, snapping apart the intenal teeth
customer_reviews.text: Chuck was stuck tight as seems to be a common problem. I was one of the few people able to finally get it loosened, however one of the three teeth was snapped in half because it had been on so tight.... rendering the keyless chuck useless. Also, no bubble level as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: B Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Useless, chuck is stuck in wide open position and set too tight to loosen.  Several others have had the same issue.
customer_reviews.text: Useless right out of the box. The chuck is stuck in the wide open position, and not amount of force I can apply (without risking major damage to the drill) does not loosen it. Read through the questions on this product, and you will find that several other people have had the exact same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Keeney

customer_reviews.title: Nice, basic
customer_reviews.text: Nice, basic, inexpensive and does not require recharging. Keyless chuck, reverse, variable speed, plenty of torque but no torque adjust. Good cord strain relief and light weight. Case is slender enough for most tight places. Long life is expected.
customer_reviews.author: ezmuny

customer_reviews.title: It drills...
customer_reviews.text: It drills...although you’ll need to get some drill bits separately. The cord is not super long so you may need an extension cord depending on the job. It comes with one double sided driver bit (Phillips and flat-head) which slots into the bottom of the handle. I can’t speak to how well this works with stone or metal, but for typical wood and drywall work I’ve rarely felt the need to pull the trigger all the way to full speed. I’ve noticed a slight squeak recently after I disengage the trigger but it may be my fault for getting some water and Mr. Clean on it while using a revolver brush. I’m very pleased with this product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: changing review again
customer_reviews.text: my original review was 5 stars b/c it worked great...unfort, i had to change to a 1 star b/c the chuck froze on me. with no help from the manufacturer, i somehow finally managed to loosen it so it is working fine again. i give it 4 stars b/c of that problem. hopefully, it will not freeze again. i see many others have had this problem so be careful when tightening the chuck. it is a very affordable drill & other than that, works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Steph DeFerie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for DIY drill lathe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drill for one very specific purpose, and that is for use as a turning lathe to make fishing bobbers/floats from wine corks and bamboo skewers. I needed an inexpensive corded drill at around 500 rpm, with a feature allowing to lock it in the "on" position so I didn't have to rig a zip-tie around the trigger. Now I have a $25 portable mini cork turning lathe, and I can turn a bobber in about 5 minutes. I will update my review in several months to address any possible performance issues, but for now it's working perfectly. I've attached pix of an unfinished batch.
customer_reviews.author: Ø™Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many drills in 50 years. Been using mostly cordless (Makita). Finally had enough of batteries losing charge to quickly and having to buy replacement batteries just to have those go bad just as I finish a job. Decided to buy a cheap drill as a back up. Little black and decker is now my go to back up. Still need the cordless for jobs. But the corded decker is surprisingly strong and so far very reliable. Just about the only tool I can rely on. And it was cheap. I’m a happy man.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: so I will continue all avenues in an attempt to loosen it however it's no longer useful for the reason I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I have literally destroyed the chuck in an attempt to get it loosened. Channel locks, pipe wrench, vice, very large friends...nothing can unlock the chuck. Obviously I can't return the thing based on the condition of said chuck, so I will continue all avenues in an attempt to loosen it however it's no longer useful for the reason I ordered. I commend those that were able to accomplish the impossible but sadly, on this day, it wasn't to be.
customer_reviews.author: SJP

customer_reviews.title: Great for occasional drilling
customer_reviews.text: Like most looking at this drill, you probably need a drill once a year or so. I had a cordless, but 5 years later, I have no idea where the battery and charging cord is. I decided to buy a corded one in order not to keep up with this stuff and to save me the hassle of waiting for the drill to charge. This was perfect for drilling into a wood stud in order to hang a t.v. mount. The price was excellent. Now I can throw it into a box until next year without worrying about losing components. If you need a drill around the house for occasional use, just get this.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Best household drill for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dads old drill finally bit the dust and I needed a basic drill for household repairs. I’ve had quite a bit of experience using various drills throughout the years and I must say that this is the best drill I’ve bought for such a low price!!! The drill is pretty light weight for the somewhat bulky size. So far it has shown enough strength to drive screws through 2x4s with ease. The cord is pretty standard and the bit holder on bottom of the handle hasn’t stabbed me yet so I’m very happy with my purchase. Will be updating on the longevity and durability of the drill after a few projects 🤙🏽
customer_reviews.author: Nicole T.

customer_reviews.title: Great simple corded drill
customer_reviews.text: Needed it to put together 6' bookcases that used screws on the back instead of the typical little nails. Got a blister on my palm from building the first one, and not all the nails were even screwed in all the way! Couldn't face the second and third bookcase with a manual screwdriver, so ordered this drill and it arrived the next day! Luckily the screw bits were included with the drill. Reverse worked well when needed. Keyless chuck worked fine. Have not used it with drill bits, but well worth the cost to assemble the bookcases.
customer_reviews.author: jk-nyc

customer_reviews.title: Exception quality for an almost insignificant price.
customer_reviews.text: This drill has an enormous amount of power and has very high rpm, in spite of other drills claiming to have higher rpm than this drill. It is very finely made, high powered and very smooth. I think other drills that sell for much more than this one are not better. For an affordable drill, it vastly exceeded my expectations. One thing though, it is larger than the photos might lead you to believe and it is a bit heavy, but truly a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: sean moton

customer_reviews.title: A little heavier than I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for lightweight drills. I am disabled and needed something i could use without taking a lot of breaks. It isn't so heavy that I would bother returning it, and I think I will be able to manage it with practice. A lot of folks have complained about the tightness of the chuck but mine was freely moving and took no effort at all. It seems to have plenty of power for household use and I particularly like the ease of use of the variable speed. No bag or case, but it easily goes back into the box, cord and all.
customer_reviews.author: Carma

customer_reviews.title: This drill comes with a stuck clutch
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered the first one, it came with a clutch stuck in the open position. Impossible to close, it's wedged really good. I did a replacement on Amazon, but whatcha know - the replacement unit had the same problem. Maybe just a bad batch that someone wants to unload for cheap on Amazon. Maybe if I get two large plumbers adjustable wrenches, I can get it open, but these wrenches cost most than the drill. Maybe I can just replace the bad clutch, but either way, beware of this model on Amazon, you regret wasting your money and time.
customer_reviews.author: M Tian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill! My wife and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome deal! I bought this for my wife and she loves it. This drill works very well. It’s good quality and you can’t beat the price. It’s also very easy to use. She’s used it to build saw horses and a work bench so far without any problems. And she loves that there is no key to keep up with. It’s hand tightened to hold bits in place which she is able to do without assistance from me. It doesn’t require being cranked down on hard to hold the bit in place. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S. Panos Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't what I was looking for. Some years ago I had purchased a variable speed Black & Decker and thought this would be the same. Not. I guess they no longer offer the adjustable trigger. My old one had a knob on the trigger that you could either tighten or loosen, tighter basically stopped the trigger at a certain point so the speed would not increase. The new one did not have that feature so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Tawcat

customer_reviews.title: Bought again
customer_reviews.text: I have used this set for years and then in our one move my husband lost it somewhere in abyss that we couldn't find. So I bought this second time as I was super satisfied with it. I use extension wire as its own wire is pretty short but it doesn't fail like rechargeable ones which would always interrupt by needing to recharge. Works great to screw and unscrew furniture. You cant beat the price for something this efficient to fulfill all your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: aluminum shavings are hot, beware
customer_reviews.text: Used this to drill out an existing hole to tap rethreads for a coil/insert m12 1.25, cleaned out hole with some effort, but not the fault of the drill. Drill bit was slipping, it was old and subsequently broke off right after completing task. Purchased solely for this project and came through for me. Satisfied and for the price, quite happy. Drilled hole for compact vehicle's subframe, aluminum. Please wear safety glasses, shavings were hot :-)
customer_reviews.author: Blue Adept

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 77 year old guy, handyman and amateur redneck engineer, building a gazebo. Needed a light but powerful 3/8” drill to replace a tired and not too powerful Harbor Freight drill. This one fills the bill nicely. Especially like the push switch for reversing, much more positive than the flip switch above the trigger on the HF drill. I expect many good years of use from this drill. Some have commented that it is too powerful and sinks a screw head into the wood. Yes, it will do that unless you use your God-given brain and ease up on the trigger. Personally, I love this thing and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, good drill
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, good drill seems pretty sturdy also. you always will need a corded drill because that battery is going to give out at the worst time.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just needed something to hang curtains with, but this drill will be able to do more in the future. I had no issue with the choke/adjustment like a lot of people reported. I also noticed one person left a bad review b/c they didn't seem to realize the drill has a switch (like almost all drills) to go clockwise/counterclockwise (forward/reverse). I wish people would also realize there are different kinds of drills for different purposes. This isn't meant to drill concrete, but worked great for stud mounting heavy duty curtain rods.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Recurring Problem - Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this drill/driver. There are several complaints going back a couple of years regarding the chuck being too tight and unable to accept the bits. I figured the issue had been resolved since the complaints were over a year old. I was wrong; mine had the same difficulty. I reported the problem to Black & Decker who denied they knew of the issue and had no solution to the problem. Neither did the local B&D service center, who told me to return it. Now I'm stuck with trying to figure out how to send it back, or use it as a very ugly doorstop. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: MJB

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously tight chuck.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I am one of the many people that can't open/close the chuck. It's insanely tight. I've tried by hand, nothing. I've used wrenches and it moves a bit but never loosens enough to spin by hand. I tried WD-40, still no. I tried the help line: I waited on hold for an hour! (1-800-544-6986) and then was told my call couldn't be answered and was dumped. I want to return the product, but the Amazon timeline has expired. If you are tempted to chance buying this product, make sure you test it immediately, so you can return it if you get the same quality I received. . Home project cancelled for today. Shame. Not able to recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: William J Martin

customer_reviews.title: Holds its own with anything else of comperable price
customer_reviews.text: This is as good as any other drill I have used in the price point. It does not have many features (different torque settings/non trigger adjusted speeds) but does the job very well for light projects around the house. Out of the box I used it for over an hour straing of masonry drilling and it did get the job done (not a quickly as other more expensive drills but it did it well)
customer_reviews.author: DLEW

customer_reviews.title: First class tool for all that I do....
customer_reviews.text: This was a good investment...No more dead batteries...or waiting for a battery to recharge. After a few years of owning a cordless drill...I went back to basics with this B/D Corded Drill...Should have done this a long time ago. With all the small handy work I might do around the house, I know I can count on a great workable tool such as this. Can't go wrong with my Black & Decker Corded Drill. As a side note here...This drill was priced through the Amazon nation for much less than buying a new battery for the cordless. Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: U.B. Ware

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for small house projects
customer_reviews.text: I love this little power drill. It seems to have a lot of power..i just needed something for small projects around the house..i didnt want to have to deal with battery packs dying on me so i bought rhis corded one! The cord itself isnt that long so i would make sure to have an extension cord around wish it came with more bits too especially of different sizes but hey i guess i can buy them! I still love it! So far ive drilled holes in some wood (bought seperate attachment) and drilled some key/coat hooks into some wood as well using the screwdriver bit and it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Sps

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting and would have been content with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting and would have been content with a cheaply made but effective power tool for a low price. Becoming besides myself when up packing a substantial, high quality tool that managed the job quickly and had more improved features then seemed possible for the price, Too lazy to check the US inflation rate from 1984 until today, it's likely to around 10 times in the USD value compared with 2016. The last Black & Decker hand held electric drill purchased in 1984, cost much more (inflation not included) and was less powerful, significantly versatility, and a marked diminishment in quality construction. What has happened, this cost less then our local hardware store, visited by my wife today.
customer_reviews.author: Republica Peruanu

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner!
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner at the "DIY" lifestyle and I feel very comfortable with this drill. I chose to go with a corded one because it is cheaper and I was not sure I wanted to invest in the cordless ones. Plus, my current workspace is a small patio so it doesn't need to go far. I am glad I bought this one but I am 80% sure when I buy a home I will upgrade to a cordless. Simply because the DIY projects only get bigger and I can't imagine trying to install shelving or curtains unless I get an extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: gahudnall

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight drill
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want a pink drill but wanted a corded drill to do minor things around the house. I'm not building furniture or installing cabinets ... just hanging blinds, curtains and shelving units. I figured a corded drill would be lighter for me than a cordless drill. This worked great. I was able to do what needed to be done and not worry the battery will go bad before I use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Wireless
customer_reviews.text: After seeing the price to replace my charger and another battery.. ridiculous.. I went with this.. Goodbye Wireless.. lighter than wireless.. enough power and a good price.. I wish they still had the chuck key of past but this is just fine.. I will get longer extension chords and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelD

customer_reviews.title: This is not the drill i received!
customer_reviews.text: At the time I ordered this, I was surprised when I received it how small it was, the pics made it seem much larger. However I was in the Middle of selling 2 homes and purchasing a new home 800 miles away and so i forgot about it. I just came on to research my order because i lost the power supply in the move and now realize the drill i received was NOT the one pictured here. Of course it is way too late to return or complain at this point. Just an fyi....Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Drove 6" lag screws through hardwood.
customer_reviews.text: I built shelving in my garage using this. Drove 3" screws through Douglas fir for an entire weekend without getting hot. This drill even drove about 35 6"×3/8" roofing screws into my heavy duty shelves used for storing truck parts. If it can handle that it can handle just about anything you can throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Wagshol

customer_reviews.title: How do they make these so cheaply?
customer_reviews.text: My rechargeable from many years back finally bit the dust! Battery not available anymore, so I took a risk and got this one. Amazing, I can’t imagine, not sure I want to, how they can produce an item like this for $24, boggles the mind. Anyhow, it worked, and seems quite powerful, tho I was only drilling wood with smallish bit. A bit loud and next time I’ll wear earplugs, but I doubt I’ll ever go back to rechargeable for the few things I need a drill for... absolute bargain!
customer_reviews.author: pen name

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a small older woman and this drill works great for quick jobs around the house. I was tired of the bulk of my cordless drills and the wait for charging up the battery. This drill fits fine in my hand, is balanced, and light weight. Plug it in and go. Variable feature works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Moonchild

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Manufacturing Defect
customer_reviews.text: I'm only writing this review to offset the five stars and to caution potential buyers. As other reviewers have warned, this drill has a fatal defect in its manufacturing. The keyless chuck is supposed to stay locked while drilling, but even when tightened, it will come loose and suddenly open. This makes the drill bit fly out. A dangerous situation if you're using a wirebrush or cutting tool. The cheap price isn't worth a trip to the ER. I would recommend everyone avoid this model.
customer_reviews.author: 6 Month Reviews

customer_reviews.title: New style is well balanced, feels good in the hand....
customer_reviews.text: ...and easy to control. Trigger ramps up the motor smoothly to 1500 RPMs, keyless chuck works well and has good grip on drill shanks and runs true centered This one is even a bit more powerful than my previous Black & Decker drill and at a lower price than multiple years ago. Only item I don't care for is the placement of the double headed bit at the lower end of the grip... it sticks out too far and can stick your palm when you move your hand around using the drill... I have to leave the bit out of the holder... Power, design and low price make it a five star product to me
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Extremely handy, great balance between weight, power, size and feel
customer_reviews.text: * This little guy was definitely more than I expected, specifically in terms of power. We just moved in a new town house and I couldn't do with only the cordless drill. * It went easily through studs, tiles, metal and concrete (well, choose some good drill bits, too...) * I installed bikes on hoists on the ceiling and I needed something very powerful to screw those bolts in. Easy peasy with this drill * Extremely handy, great balance between weight, power, size and feel. * If you use it as a screwdriver, be careful. I broke two concrete screws with it... :( Great buy, couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei

customer_reviews.title: This one is okay but not great. It's a little noisier that my previous one
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Black and Decker drill that finally gave up and I got this one to replace it. This one is okay but not great. It's a little noisier that my previous one, but my biggest issue is that the chuck seems to have too much play in it once you secure a bit in it. It just seems to have several millimeters of play in it. It's not a big deal for most drilling, but when I use it with a 1/16" drill bit to precisely drill bolts for safety wire it's pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you need a decent drill but don't want to break the bank, I would definitely recommend this one. My only gripe is that the cord seems a bit short, so very rarely do I not need to use a heavy duty extension cord with it. I also wish it came with more bits than just the double sided Philips and flat head screwdriver bits, especially since its use is mostly as a drill--it should at least come with a standard drill bit or two. Outside of that, the drill works perfect, fits well in the hand. I saw in the reviews that many buyers received theirs with an overtightened chuck, but mine was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Hikaru Yuy

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill for the Price....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drill to replace my old corded drill that bit the dust after 3 decades of occasional use. Good quality, well balanced, powerful motor. Good price. Never have to worry about the battery being depleted, because there isn't one.....
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. previously in Silicon Valley (now WA.)

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done in a mediocre fashion.
customer_reviews.text: Not really a fault of the drill/driver itself, but the cord's length is just a bit lacking. I can understand why people pay up and buy cordless rechargeable models. The cord makes this a pain to use. There's also no speed control. It's either stopped, or spinning so fast you can't control it. I bought this because it was cheap, and the old adage "you get what you pay for" is true.
customer_reviews.author: MyLossIsYourGain

customer_reviews.title: A mean Beast
customer_reviews.text: For a Black & Decker this thing does have some major torque, if you need a good sturdy drill that can easily twist it's way out of your hand if you're not careful this is it, torque Galore. Downfalls, it's a heavy bugger, and although with a variable speed trigger it would have been nice to have a torque control. For the price a good purchase, it's a real Workhorse at the lower end of the scale.
customer_reviews.author: scott gamble

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and well made
customer_reviews.text: I whipped this out of the box to do some simple chores requiring a Phillips screwdriver. The Phillips and regular screwdriver parts are attached to the drill. Power is full-on sufficient and easily controlled when you don't need overkill. It's light and well made, and balanced in the hand. Basic, powerful and easy to figure out without reading the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: pmisun

customer_reviews.title: The best $20 I've spent in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved to a new house and have had a lot of furniture to put together. My hands already sore from all the moving, this made putting everything together a breeze. I use it mostly as a screwdriver, but also as a drill for light projects. I didn't want the cordless one since I probably won't use it enough long term to justify maintaining and buying replacement batteries. This has been ideal for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up for Black & Decker
customer_reviews.text: Must have for tons of little and big jobs around the house. Compact design, not too heavy, easy to hold and use. Who needs a drill with a V8 engine when this little number pretty well does it all for general home repair? Used this the first time to put a chicken coup together that had "50 million" screws. Works effortlessly and without fail, true to the Black & Decker reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Gezellige_PoesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not a Single Complaint!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'd like to say I used it, but truth be told, my guy did. I bought it for my house to help put up my tv wall mount (my old battery operated one died), but he actually said to not buy Black and Decker (he prefers another brand) but since it's all I had he used it - and I didn't hear a single complaint! (Which means it was really good but he wasn't going to admit it!) It was a great price and will be just perfect for household use. I'll be putting up some curtain holders soon so I'll let you know if I have any comments once I actually use it!
customer_reviews.author: Superstefmom

customer_reviews.title: Very inexpensive and powerful. Unit is heavy and scary ...
customer_reviews.text: Very inexpensive and powerful. Unit is heavy and scary when using at full power. It's loud and shoots out lots of air from the vents. Can be used as a mini leaf blower. Drilled thtough wall studs with little effort. Speed and heat generate a smell from the pilot hole and drill bit. Its a far cry from the weak and light and rather worthless consumer cordless drills that need constant charging. The power cord is an okay length at six feet.
customer_reviews.author: Chocobo Sandwich

customer_reviews.title: Very nice drill
customer_reviews.text: I don't use a drill that often, and I don't like cordless tools. This is a very nice household drill. The keyless chuck is a pleasure changing from the screw bit that I use always, to the two sizes of drill bits that I use sometimes. My last corded drill lasted 20 years, I hope to have this one for that long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: reversable drill,sturdy low cost drill
customer_reviews.text: Did some testing with the drill, foreward and reverse. worked just fine. I like the fact that the plastic housing is thick not flimsey lightweight plastic. It should stand up to accedental abuse well. For $22 w/tax I had to get it, I've been contemplating purchasing a new drill for some time. Overall I think this was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: uWizz

customer_reviews.title: Can use it when needed without having to worry about any batteries being charged
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight. Enough power for house use and occasional heavy jobs. No batteries needed, being electrical, so you can use it whenever, without need top recharge before need.
customer_reviews.author: Benito A. leon

customer_reviews.title: How to open the chuck
customer_reviews.text: This power drill works great! I've already built a bookshelf and a TV stand with it. No problem at all! Here, many customers say that it's extremely hard to do. Actually, it's easy! All you need to do is to rotate the chuck in the clockwise direction! The instructions that come with the drill are misleading. They tell you that when you have a drilling bit inside, then you need to rotate the chuck counter-clockwise to loosen it up. However, when you receive the drill from Amazon, it's the opposite! There is no bit inside, so you need to put a drilling bit in, and tighten the chuck by rotating it clockwise. It's that easy!
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandr Smirnov

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent for simple household tasks. I haven’t tried it for any heavy duty jobs so no comment on that. It’s very nice having control over speed. I reeeeally dislike the “keyless chuck” part though. It was not fun removing the chuck. I have to find small enough screw driver and right size Allen wrench. Other than that, this drill has been super!
customer_reviews.author: bee

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a couple thousand uses, then the speed controller went out.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the purpose of removing and reinstalling 500sqft of decking. This consisted of removing and replacing about 4000 screws total. It did well right up until the end of the project when the speed controller went out, so I now only have the full-blast speed. With that being said, I got a ton of us out of a very cheap drill and it ended up being a heck of a lot better than fusing with batteries for a cordless.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus M

customer_reviews.title: Slow or GO ... It's Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill. It's light enough that it doesnt put undue stress on my oldish wrists, but the very best feature, in my opinion, is how easy it is to control the speed. It's so easy to keep the speed down; perfect for drilling holes in planting pots and just as easy to maintain a high speed for anything less delicate.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: No battery so won't die like my other drills
customer_reviews.text: After spending hundreds on tools 10 years ago I discovered none of my batteries hold a charge. This has no battery. I bought an extension cord to go with it. My only issue is the drill is long and I need an offset one for some areas. If it mattered that much I could buy a shorter drill but this is great for my needs. I only need drills once a year or so, on flatpack furniture.
customer_reviews.author: CAB, mom of 6

customer_reviews.title: I don't need a drill often, but give me ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't need a drill often, but give me an electric drill any day, especially this one. I'm so over the battery ones that don't charge, or run out in the middle of hanging drapery rods or whatever I'm doing. This drill is just enough for what I need. Has variable speed, so I can start slow and not ream out the screws I'm drilling. Not too heavy. And has an on board slot for the drill bit I use the most. Price was important too.
customer_reviews.author: LadyE

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this bad boy forsure.
customer_reviews.text: Got mine for 12 USD and im pumped over it lol been wanting a drill so when i seen this i had too. I havent had any problems and it has all the quality as if it was 40 plus USD.
customer_reviews.author: xKhino.Twitch.tv

customer_reviews.title: Great Price - 5-Star Drill
customer_reviews.text: It is more powerful than I expected, and with the handle near the middle of the body, it is well balanced. I'm building a shed using screws instead of nails, and working with this drill all day does not tire my wrist like other drills I have.
customer_reviews.author: Bones

customer_reviews.title: Stan the Man Reviews: Corded Drill
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little drill for the money. I got tired of that battery baloney which, I admit, is great, if you do use a drill more than once or twice a year like I do. For having a drill handy, this works. It is always charged too except during power failures. Then you will need one of the LED flashlights I just finished reviewing to put it away until the lights come back on. It's not battery powered. But buy it now.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Troy Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to loosen the chuck
customer_reviews.text: We liked that it was corded. My husband couldn't loosen the chuck, because it was way too tight. Husband sprayed wd-40, used a vice grip, nothing worked. We had Amazon replace it and returned what we thought was damaged goods. The new one came within a day. Again, my husband couldn't loosen the chuck. We gave up and returned it for a refund. What a shame.... Not even worth a star.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful, well constructed,reliable equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I really am pleased with the power of this tool, the fact that i didn't need a key to tighten the bits was great also. i was happy to see both phillips head & flat head screwdriver bit too. A good purchase for me & anyone who needs a drill that's lightweight & manageable..
customer_reviews.author: Wt

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I wanted a corded drill for heavy grinding and brushing during a restoration. This kept up fine and still working fine. Great buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Great drill for around the house
customer_reviews.text: For the price, a well made tool. Speed control is nicely variable and it has a lot of low RPM torque. Not too heavy and the cord is a decent length. Not as fast as some of my older drills but for doing general handy-work around the house that needs screws putting into wood or pilot holes drilled into material, can't fault it.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Omg, this is a great price and great quality. We wanted a drill at home for small projects and this is amazing. I would definitely recommend, just make sure you own an extension cord. There is no worries about making sure the drill is charge or looking for charger before you do something, this drill comes through.
customer_reviews.author: Harlyn

customer_reviews.title: It's Black & Decker, what else would you expect but quality!
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved and couldn't find my cordless drill. I needed something in a hurry, and knew that I could receive it from Amazon quickly. So I ordered a cheaper version of what I have had. I am not disappointed! Black & Decker you're the best! This little drill does everything that I needed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt disappoint for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap power drill. Bought it to drill through heavy porcelain tile after I caught a crackhead in my garage running away with my last drill... This drill worked like a champ. Would be nice if it had some levels but if it did there wouldnt be much reason to buy the more expensive drills...
customer_reviews.author: mcgumps

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised and quite a bit more Savings
customer_reviews.text: This drill/driver works great and is highly efficient, powerful, and half of what you wold pay for some of the other brands. I recommend this product 100%
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Pretty strong and a lot of air blowing out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it the minute it arrived. (put up blinds) Holy molly what power. Pretty strong and a lot of air blowing out of it. Heavy enough not to feel flimsy and apply pressure but not too heavy where you can't hold it to do the job. Did i mention the great affordable price? Only down side i wish the wire was longer but a power strip gets it done.
customer_reviews.author: MonicaW

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered to end my frustration with ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered to end my frustration with units with batteries where the replacement batteries are more expensive than the original unit. Really should have done this years ago. Just threw away the old cordless instead of buying another battery that is just going to die in a few years anyway. Alternating current. What a concept!
customer_reviews.author: Marie D.

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful for the size
customer_reviews.text: I had one of those battery operated drills that had no power. I only had it since it was so cheap. I stopped using it since it never did what I wanted it to do. Then I saw this Black and Decker drill and decided to try it out. I absolutely love it. It drills almost instantly. I don't mind that you need to have an extension cord, I already had one so it was no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Something I can call my own
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to get my own electric drill my brother-in-law have this same name brand of a drill and it works spectacular into doing my project, I had to borrow his drill ,which he let me keep it for at least a couple of weeks, but then he wanted it back, and I was not done with my project yet, so I decided to order me one,& I did appreciate him letting me borrowr his that way I got to know what a good drill it was.
customer_reviews.author: jewl of the nile

customer_reviews.title: Great corded drill
customer_reviews.text: Unquestionably, the best bang for the buck. A powerful, multispeed, corded 3/8inch drill of solid build for under 20 bucks. And you get a double screwdriver bit for free. Corded drills just make sense for lots of chores in the shop where you have power and a need to drill a substantial hole. Works great with my pocket screw jig setup where a dying battery drill would be a real pain. Also works great for sanding on my lathe.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G

customer_reviews.title: Haven't gotten one that works yet
customer_reviews.text: Two for two on drills that come with the chuck completely stuck open. Not even two massive monkey wrenches were able to loosen them. I'll update this review if I ever manage to get one that works before I get fed up and just get a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This drill is amazing. My only issue is that it doesn't fit into small spaces easily. I fixed this with bit extensions but if you're looking for a small drill, keep looking. If you're looking for a powerful drill of good quality, hit purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill
customer_reviews.text: I don't do many repairs but needed a drill to put in a new air exchange. This was perfect for the job since the frame was not the right fit, i needed to put in screws at a sharp angle to make it work. This drill had the lightweight and maneuverability to allow me to perform the job.
customer_reviews.author: Dg7258

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Use this drill for concrete and brick walls, had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Pqosirkd

customer_reviews.title: Great drill and even better price
customer_reviews.text: Used this drill for the first time today and wasn’t disappointed. I’m tired of battery drills that run out halfway through a job or when the battery starts to not charge as well either. It’s veey powerful, a bit louder than others I’ve used but that comes with the power. I noticed others had problems with the changing of drill bits, or something similar and I didn’t have that problem so  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: This drill works perfectly for me. I never had problems others had described... plenty of power... great price... perfect for occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: LOM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Drill For Home Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill for my wife, and she loves it. It is light weight, and is all the drill you would need for around the house projects. Cordless drills tend to be quite heavy, so my wife wanted a lighter drill. This drill is perfect for her.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Ockinga

customer_reviews.title: Chuck super hard to loosen first time but other than that, great drill!
customer_reviews.text: Neither myself, mother or sister could loosen the chuck to insert a bit the first time! We had to go ask a neighbor for help, and even he, with his beautiful muscles and all, didn't loosen it with ease. But in the end he did and we were off to screwing! Now what to do with the 3 cordless drills that sit in the garage with dead batteries? Very happy with this drill, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Taladro

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Works as normal except when reversing the Chuck releases no matter how tight it is. Twice could not get Chuck to tighten at all. Mechanism jams fully open.
customer_reviews.author: jcg

customer_reviews.title: will work for light jobs, no built in bubble level
customer_reviews.text: I needed it to drill a few holes to wall mount a TV. Not sure if there is a lack of torque, or whether I am not operating it properly (this is my first plug-in drill). It had trouble drilling into studs, an issue I never had with very old NiCD drill. Lack of integrated level is unfortunate. There was also some part rattling inside.
customer_reviews.author: johndoe13

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a very powerful drill!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing drill! I absolutely love it! I use this drill for everything I need to do around the house. I also used it to drill holes in my garden plant pots! Great price for a very powerful drill.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Pace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent driver/drill
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical when I bought this. How could it be decent quality for the price, I wondered. I am happy to say that it is excellent quality and does its job well. It doubles as a screwdriver and drill and I have been very pleased with its performance in both categories.
customer_reviews.author: The Apostle

customer_reviews.title: Unusably weak
customer_reviews.text: A very weak drill. I can stop it from spinning with barely any effort. Unsuitable for basic household tasks (like drilling holes in things, or tightening or loosening screws). The first bullet point for the item description says "powerful" but oh what a meaningless, qualitative term. It's an extremely weak drill, and I'm going to donate it to Goodwill. I suppose if all you want to do is drill holes in drywall, it's probably strong enough for that.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but reasonable
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy but seems to be decent quality. I bought based on price. If you can afford a name brand lithium-ion cordless drill then spend the extra money. If you won't need to use a drill often or can only afford a low I quality cordless drill, then buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for anyone who doesn’t need a heavy duty drill
customer_reviews.text: Had an old 19v cordless one that was useless because when it was needed it rarely had any charge. So bought this cheap corded one to replace it. Since I always am within and extension cord of a power outlet it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: John Secondino

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for average person
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for me. It does what it suppoed to for light duty house work.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin han

customer_reviews.title: It’s a drill!
customer_reviews.text: It works! Nothing complicated here just a good working drill without the headache of charging batteries. Cable is decently long and like that even the option without a drill bit kit comes with a screwdriver attachment for both Phillips and flathead that has a place to keep it stored on the handle so it doesn’t get lost. Fast shipping too
customer_reviews.author: Soyu

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool to mix mortar for my ceramics tiles in my basement, as I MIGHT push it a little too far, as sometimes, the motor smokes. But it comes back for the net job.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Vespe

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well. I've been able to complete any task around the house with this drill. I dropped it once and some plastic come off but it's working perfectly. Durability may be an issue if you are using it for anything other than around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Really nice to have a drill without a battery It's very ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice to have a drill without a battery It's very powerful Easy to use and change bits Cord pretty short but that is how all of these are made Stupid placement of the screw head bit, but I just remove it from the bottom of the handle every time I use it (it scratches against your hand)
customer_reviews.author: Jake M

customer_reviews.title: Go back to corded
customer_reviews.text: Need to replace an old cordless drill. Had always been unsatisfied with the cordless. Only used it occasionally and the charge was never fullband always lacked power. Went back to this corded and will never turn back. Those little jobs when I need a drill right now finally get done. Or... Those bigger jobs where I need power for hours are now not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dasher

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It was a little tight at first but used my jar openers to grip it, then got it open and I'm a weakling. Wish the cord was longer, could be twice as long really. Had to use an extension cord to drill on the high part of my wall even though the plug was just below and I don't have high ceilings. But glad to not be dealing with recharging or the extra weight on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M.

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a back-up to my battery-operated drill set. It is well constructed and has nice features for a reasonably priced drill. Plenty of power makes it a good option for those jobs that require a lot of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bart

customer_reviews.title: Best drill for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This little drill had plenty of power! I was backing odd 2 inch wood screws out of an old deck. My cordless drills couldn't begin to touch the job, but this drill dug in and got it done.
customer_reviews.author: R.C. White

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Broke after the 3rd time I used it. They use plastic mounts for the gearing and the gear popped out of it. I put it back together and it popped out again. If I were you I'd find something else.
customer_reviews.author: MB

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Corded Drill, 5.2-Amp, 3/8-Inch (DR260C)
product_meta.description: Style:DrillThe Black & Decker DR260C 5.5 Amp 3/8" Drill/Driver is powerful and compact, capable of handling tough tasks in tight spaces. This drill operates from 0-1,500 rpm, features a keyless chuck for quick and easy bit changes, along with variable speed for controlled drilling and driving. The on-board bit storage allows for quick access to screwdriving bits. This drill is perfect for drilling holes in wood, metal and plastic, and driving screws to fasten a variety of material. Includes: (1) DR260 Drill/Driver, (1) Double-Ended Screwdriving Bit.
feature_bullets: Powerful and Compact to get the job done
Variable Speed for control during drilling/driving
On Board Bit Storage for convenience
Chuck Size: 3/8 in; Included Components: (1) DR260 Drill/Driver, (1) Double-Ended Screwdriving Bit

specifications.Included Components: Construction - Power Drills, Cordless Drills, Power Drill Drivers
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,878 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
